unittitle.value: John Tegnell Collection on John Watts

extent.value: in 2 folders in a shared tall manuscript box

abstract.value: John Everett Watts, Jr. (1929–1982) was an American composer of electronic music throughout the 1970s and 1980s. The John Tegnell Collection on John Watts contains an undated Composers Festival Orchestra list of musicians; two letters from John Watts to John Tegnell in 1973 and 1976; a 1977 photograph of Watts; and an undated annotated score <emph render="italic">Z</emph> from a performance featuring Watts.

p.value: Identification of item, date; John Tegnell Collection on John Watts; MSS 584; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Ann Tegnell, daughter of John Tegnell, on November 14, 2018. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.047.

John Carl Tegnell (1916-2008) was an American professor of voice and choral music at  Illinois Wesleyan, the University of Tennessee, and for 30 years at San Francisco State University where he was also department chair.
<lb/>
<lb/>
John Everett Watts, Jr. (1929–1982) was an American composer of electronic music throughout the 1970s and 1980s. Watts was also a faculty member at the New School for Social Research in New York City from 1969 until 1982, where he directed the Electronic Music Program and coordinated music workshops, concerts, and festivals.

This collection contains an undated Composers Festival Orchestra list of musicians; two letters sent from John Watts to John Tegnell in 1973 and 1976; a 1977 photograph of Watts; and an undated annotated score, <emph render="italic">Z</emph>, from a performance featuring Watts.
